member.name: M:RogueEssence.Dungeon.DungeonScene.IterateEvents``1(RogueEssence.Dungeon.DungeonScene.EventEnqueueFunction{``0})
member.summary: Iterates through all GameEvents gathered by the enqueue function, in order of priority. Each individual tier of priority is gathered and processed before searching for the next one. This is done so that GameEffects that affect other GameEffects at a further priority can take effect immediately.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.Data.BattleData.BeforeTryActions
member.summary: Occurs before the attacker tries to use the skill. If the skill is cancelled here, the turn and skill are not used.

member.summary: Occurs before the attacker uses the skill. If the skill is cancelled here, the turn will still be passed.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.Data.BattleData.OnActions
member.summary: Occurs right after the attacker uses the skill. The skill will have been called out, and the turn will be passed. In a skill with multiple strikes, this event will be called at the beginning of each strike.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.Data.BattleData.BeforeExplosions
member.summary: Occurs after a tile is targeted and before it creates a splash damage hitbox. Can be used to alter the hitbox or redirect it.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.Data.BattleData.BeforeHits
member.summary: Occurs before the target is hit. At this point, the target variable is available for calculations.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.Data.BattleData.OnHits
member.summary: Occurs when the target is hit. Does not occur if the target evaded the attack.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.Data.BattleData.OnHitTiles
member.summary: Occurs when the attack hits a tile. Can be used for terrain deformation.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.Data.BattleData.AfterActions
member.summary: Occurs after all targets are hit by the skill. In a skill with multiple strikes, this event will be called at the end of each strike.

member.name: M:RogueEssence.Data.GameProgress.UpdateOptions
member.summary: Updates the game-relevant options to the settings. Called whenever the settings change in a currently running game. Called whenever a new game is started, in order to inherit the existing settings. Called whenever a game is resumed, to update the settings to those that may have changed. DO NOT call when a replay is started. Not that it would do anything... DO NOT call if a replay is in progress. Not that it would do anything...

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.GridFloorGen
member.summary: A floor generator that utilizes a grid plan. The grid plan is a grid of X by Y cells, which can be filled by a room generator. Additionally, horizontal and vertical hallways connect the cells to each other. Using this generator allows for gen steps that operate on grid plans. It also allows everything RoomFloorGen allows.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.RoomFloorGen
member.summary: A floor generator that utilizes a floor plan. The floor plan a list of rooms and hallways, which can be placed in any location. The room and hall positions are not confined to a grid. Using this generator allows for gen steps that operate on floor plans. It also allows everything StairsFloorGen allows.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.StairsFloorGen
member.summary: A floor generator that utilizes stairs. Using this generator allows for gen steps that operate on stairs. It also allows basic tile and spawning gen steps.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.LoadGen
member.summary: A floor generator that is suited for loading maps created by the editor. Using this generator allows for gen steps that load maps. It also allows basic tile and spawning gen steps.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.RandDecay

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.LayeredSegment
member.summary: A dungeon segment where each floor has its own map generator, with no gaps in between floors. Players attempting to enter a floor in this segment will be served by the generator corresponding to the floor number they requested. An error will occur if the requested floor is out of range.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.SingularSegment
member.summary: A dungeon segment where each floor has the same map generator. Players attempting to enter a floor in this segment will be served by the same generator no matter what.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.RangeDictSegment
member.summary: A dungeon segment where multiple floors can be mapped to the same map generator. Players attempting to enter a floor in this segment will be served by the generator corresponding to the floor range that covers the number they requested. An error will occur if the requested floor is out of range.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.DictionarySegment
member.summary: A dungeon segment where each floor has its own map generator, with gaps between floors allowed. Players attempting to enter a floor in this segment will be served by the generator corresponding to the floor number they requested. An error will occur if the requested floor does not have a generator.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.FloorNameIDZoneStep
member.summary: Names all floors of the dungeon segment according to a naming convention.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.FloorNameIDZoneStep.Name
member.summary: The name to give the floors. Can use {0} for floor number.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.FloorNameIDZoneStep.Priority
member.summary: At what point in the map gen process to run the naming step in.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.CategorySpawn`1.Spawns
member.summary: The objects to spawn within this category. Assuming that this category was chosen for spawning, the chance that an object will spawn on a given floor is its spawn rate for that floor, divided by the sum of all objects' spawn rates on that floor.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.CategorySpawn`1.SpawnRates
member.summary: The spawn rate of the entire category across the entire dungeon segment. The chance that this category is chosen on a given floor is the spawn rate for that floor, divided by the sum of all categories' spawn rates on that floor.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.ItemSpawnZoneStep.Priority

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.ItemSpawnZoneStep.Spawns
member.summary: The spawn table, organized by category.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.MoneySpawnZoneStep
member.summary: Generates the table of items to spawn on all floors

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.MoneySpawnZoneStep.Priority

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.MoneySpawnZoneStep.StartAmount

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.MoneySpawnZoneStep.AddAmount

member.summary: Spreads the object across floors with specified spacing between. Good for ensuring a steady supply of food, etc.

member.name: T:RogueEssence.LevelGen.SpreadPlanQuota

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.SpreadPlanQuota.Replaceable

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.SpreadRoomZoneStep.SpreadPlan
member.summary: Determines how many floors to distribute the step to, and how spread apart they are.

member.name: F:RogueEssence.LevelGen.SpreadRoomZoneStep.Spawns

member.name: M:RogueEssence.Script.ScriptUI.ChoiceMenuYesNo(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Ask a question answered by yes or no via character dialogue to the player. WaitForChoice() must be called afterwards for the menu to be actually displayed, and for execution to suspend until the choice is returned. Then to recover the integer value indicating the result of the menu, ChoiceResult() must be called.
The Yes/No menu returns 1 for yes, and 0 for no.
member.param: Question to be asked to the user.
Whether the cursor starts on no by default

Lowest free height deficit for all the rectangles placed since the last call to SetCanvasDimensions.

member.name: M:RectPacker.Canvas.FreeHeightDeficit(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Works out the free height deficit when placing a rectangle with a required height at a given offset.
If the free height deficit is 0 or negative, there may be room to place the rectangle (still need to check for blocking occupied cells).
If the free height deficit is greater than 0, you're too close to the top edge of the canvas to place the rectangle.

member.name: M:RectPacker.Canvas.PlaceRectangle(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets the cell at x,y to occupied, and also its top and right neighbours, as needed to place a rectangle with the given width and height.
If the rectangle takes only part of a row or column, they are split.
member.param: Number of cells that the rectangle requires horizontally
Number of cells that the rectangle requires vertically
The amount of horizontal space left in the right most cells that could be used for the rectangle
The amount of vertical space left in the bottom most cells that could be used for the rectangle

member.name: M:RectPacker.Canvas.IsAvailable(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Returns true if a rectangle with the given width and height can be placed in the cell with the given x and y, and its right and top neighbours.
This method assumes that x,y is far away enough from the edges of the canvas that the rectangle could actually fit. So this method only looks at whether cells are occupied or not.
member.param: Number of cells that the rectangle requires horizontally
Number of cells that the rectangle requires vertically
The amount of horizontal space left in the right most cells that could be used for the rectangle
The amount of vertical space left in the bottom most cells that could be used for the rectangle

member.name: M:RectPacker.DynamicTwoDimensionalArray`1.InsertRow(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Inserts a row at location y. If y equals 2, than all rows at y=3 and higher will now have y=4 and higher. The new row will have y=3. The contents of the row at y=2 will be copied to the row at y=3.
If there is not enough capacity in the array for the additional row, than the internal data structure will be copied to a structure with twice the size (this copying is expensive).
member.param: Identifies the row to be split.

The height of the new row (the one at y=3 in the example). Must be smaller than the current height of the existing row.
The old row will have height = (old height of old row) - (height of new row).

member.name: M:RectPacker.DynamicTwoDimensionalArray`1.InsertColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as InsertRow, but than for columns.

member.summary: Returns the width of the column at the given location

member.summary: Returns the height of the row at the given location

member.name: M:RectPacker.DynamicTwoDimensionalArray`1.IncreaseCapacity
member.summary:
Doubles the capacity of the internal data structures.
Creates a new array with double the width and height of the old array. Copies the element of the old array to the new array. Then replaces the old array with the new array.

member.name: T:RectPacker.ImageInfo
member.summary:
Describes an image. Note that this only defines those properties that are relevant when it comes to mapping an image onto a sprite - its width and height. So for example image file name is not needed here.
This is called IImageInfo rather than IImage, because System.Drawing already defines an Image class.

member.name: T:RectPacker.OptimalMapper
member.summary:
An IMapper takes a series of images, and figures out how these could be combined in a sprite. It returns the dimensions that the sprite will have, and the locations of each image within that sprite.
This object does not create the sprite image itself. It only figures out how it needs to be constructed.

member.name: M:RectPacker.OptimalMapper.#ctor(RectPacker.Canvas,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Canvas object to use to map the images

When the object's Mapping method produces a candidate sprite with this efficiency or higher, it stops trying to get a better one and returns the sprite.
Set this to for example 0.9 if that efficiency is good enough for you. Set to 1.0 or higher if you want the most efficient sprite.

The maximum number of candidate sprites that will be generated by the Mapping method. Set this to 1 if you want it to return the very first sprite that it manages to generate. If you want it to try to generate no more than 2 sprites before returning the best one, set this to 2, etc. Set to Int32.MaxValue if you don't want any restrictions on the number of candidate sprites generated.
If you set cutoff Efficiency to less than 1, and maxNbrCandidateSprites to less than Int32.MaxValue, the Mapper method will stop trying to get a better sprite the moment it hits one of these limitations.

member.name: M:RectPacker.OptimalMapper.Mapping(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{RectPacker.ImageInfo})
member.summary: Works out how to map a series of images into a sprite.
member.param: The list of images to place into the sprite.
member.returns: A SpriteInfo object. This describes the locations of the images within the sprite, and the dimensions of the sprite.

member.name: M:RectPacker.OptimalMapper.CandidateCanvasFeasable(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Works out whether there is any point in trying to fit the images on a canvas with the given width and height.
member.param: Candidate canvas width
Candidate canvas height
Area of the smallest sprite produces so far
Total area of all images
true if the candidate canvas is bigger than the best sprite so far
true if the candidate canvas is smaller than the combined images

member.name: M:RectPacker.OptimalMapper.MappingRestrictedBox(System.Linq.IOrderedEnumerable{RectPacker.ImageInfo},System.Int32,System.Int32,RectPacker.CanvasStats,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Produces a mapping to a sprite that has given maximum dimensions. If the mapping can not be done inside those dimensions, returns null.
member.param:
List of image infos.
This method will not sort this list. All images in this collection will be used, regardless of size.
The sprite won't be wider than this.
The generated sprite won't be higher than this.
The statistics produced by the canvas. These numbers are since the last call to its SetCanvasDimensions method.

The lowest free height deficit for the images up to and including the tallest rectangle whose right hand border sits furthest to the right of all images.
This is the minimum amount by which the height of the canvas needs to be increased to accommodate that rectangle. if the width of the canvas is decreased to one less than the width now taken by images.
Note that providing the additional height might get some other (not right flushed) image to be placed higher, thereby making room for the flushed right image.
This will be set to Int32.MaxValue if there was never any free height deficit.
member.returns:
The generated sprite.
null if not all the images could be placed within the size limitations.
